c74object.name: ossia.client
c74object.digest: Connect to a distant Ossia device
c74object.description: ossia.client allows to connect to a distant device (either locally or on another computer) through various protcols, and lets you bind to it through ossia.view and ossia.remote

outlet.name: Info outlet
outlet.description: Messages and information in reply to various messages

method.name: namespace
method.digest: Output list of all parameters and their current values
method.description: Sending the namespace message to the leftmost inlet outputs the list of all parameters registered under this node, and their current values

method.name: getdevices
method.digest: Get the list of all discoverable devices on the network
method.description: Sending the getdevices message to the leftmost inlet will print to all discoverable devices that are present on the network

method.name: connect
method.digest: Connect to a global device to the network
method.description: The connect message to the leftmost inlet will print its configuration parameters for the various available protocols Then, sending it with the appropriate values will connect to the appropriate device on the network, and allow it to be explored, queried and remotely-controlled. Notice that, if the getdevices message has not been sent previously, the object will internally do it, which might take some time, and delay the actual connection accordingly.

method.name: disconnect
method.digest: Disconnect from the currently connected remoted device
method.description: The disconnect message to the leftmost inlet will disconnect ossia.client from the currently remoted device

method.name: update
method.digest: Update the namespace of the remote device
method.description: For some protocols or remote devices, the remote namespace is not automatically updated. Sending the "update" message will do this.

method.name: preset
method.description: Sending the preset save /path/to/file.txt message to the leftmost inlet will write a list of all parameters and their values to the the disk, under the file /path/to/file.txt Sending the preset load /path/to/file.txt message to the leftmost inlet will load a list of all parameters and their values from the the file /path/to/file.txt, and recall the values to the parameters

method.name: set
method.description: The set message followed by a distant node address and value will set the node to the value specified as argument

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: The tags attribute allows to associate a variable number of tags for this node. This helps documenting the parameter.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description attribute allows to give a textual description for this node. This helps documenting the parameter.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: The priority attribute allows to order how several values of a same hierarchical level can be recalled

attribute.name: invisible
attribute.description: The invisible attribute allows to hide device on the network. Note that this attribute cannot be changed once the device has been exposed on the network
